According to ''[[Alternative Press]]'', The Crimson Armada is scheduled to play on April 14 at the 13th Annual [[New England Metal and Hardcore Festival]], a three day festival.<ref>{{cite web|last=Karan|first=Tim|title=Job For A Cowboy, Bury Your Dead, Biohazard, more playing New England Metal And Hardcore Festival|url=http://www.altpress.com/news/entry/job_for_a_cowboy_bury_your_dead_biohazard_more_playing_new_england_metal_an/|work=News|publisher=Alternative Press|accessdate=10 March 2011|date=2011-02-03}}</ref> They are also set for a summer tour with [[MyChildren MyBride]], [[Impending Doom]], This Or The Apocalypse.{{citation needed|date=April 2011}}
According to ''[[Alternative Press]]'', The Crimson Armada is scheduled to play on April 14 at the 13th Annual [[New England Metal and Hardcore Festival]], a three day festival.<ref>{{cite web|last=Karan|first=Tim|title=Job For A Cowboy, Bury Your Dead, Biohazard, more playing New England Metal And Hardcore Festival|url=http://www.altpress.com/news/entry/job_for_a_cowboy_bury_your_dead_biohazard_more_playing_new_england_metal_an/|work=News|publisher=Alternative Press|accessdate=10 March 2011|date=2011-02-03}}</ref> They are also set for a summer tour with [[MyChildren MyBride]], [[Impending Doom]], This Or The Apocalypse.{{citation needed|date=April 2011}}
â   â
On September 19th the group released a teaser trailer for the music video "Forgive Me" which sparked major controversy on the bands Facebook page due to the content of the video. Vocalist, Saud Ahmed issued a statement crushing all rumors and speculations that the group is a "christian" act.
